summary: Chickens are large, round birds that were first domesticated in Southeast Asia around 8,000 years ago. They are mostly raised for food, providing meat and eggs. Some are also kept as pets or for cockfighting. As of 2023, there are 26.5 billion chickens worldwide, producing over 50 billion birds annually. A single hen can lay more than 300 eggs each year. Chickens are often featured in folklore, religion, and literature.
title: Chicken
